amendment.description: Amendment authorizes $15 million for Regional and Local Children's Advocacy Centers through 2005, and provides $5 million for grants for specialized technical assistance and training programs.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 3 printed in House Report 108-48 to re-authorize grant programs within the Victims of Child Abuse Act that provide funding to child advocacy centers and training and technical assistance to programs to improve the prosecution of child abuse cases; to add tools for the Department of Justice to evaluate these grant programs to ensure effective use of the funds provided.
